name: European Forum for Animal Welfare Councils
membership:
Membership is confined to those advisory bodies within Europe that are established by Governments to provide strategic and other advice on animal welfare. Membership of the forum is open to all European countries.
If an advisory body has not been established, then a representative of the Government Department with responsibility for animal welfare is invited to attend as an observer. The Council of Europe, the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE), the European Commission (EC), the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) and other relevant bodies are also invited to attend each meeting as observers. Communication should be maintained with potential members and observers in the hope that they will be inspired to participate.
goal: The European Forum for Animal Welfare Councils provides a platform for debate, for sharing information and views and a network for members of the Animal Welfare advisory bodies throughout Europe. The forum encourages advice relating to animal welfare to be based on scientific knowledge from multi-disciplinary fields.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Regional Policy, Research and Technology
euInitiatives: EU-initiatives and policy relating to animal welfare, EuroFAWC is member of the EU Animal Welfare Platform.
